Package mmj.gmff

Class GMFFFolder

java.lang.Object
mmj.gmff.GMFFFolder
public class GMFFFolder extends Object
GMFFFolder is a helper class for GMFF reading and writing.

  • Constructor Details

    • GMFFFolder

      public GMFFFolder(File filePath, String folderName, String exportType) throws GMFFException
      Constructor for GMFFFolder using pathname String.

      The input folderName String may be an absolute or relative path name. If it is null or an empty string, does not exist, is not a directory, or is security protected, then an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      filePath - path name for building folder. May be null, relative or absolute.
      folderName - relative or absolute path name
      exportType - Export Type parm related to this folder for use in error messages.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if folderName not found, not a readable directory, security protected, or just plain invalid.

  • Method Details

    • listFiles

      public File[] listFiles(String fileType, String lowestNamePrefix) throws GMFFException
      Returns a name-sorted array listing the files in the directory which match the input fileType and have a name greater than or equal to the input lowestNamePrefix.

      NOTE: "fileNamePrefix" refers to the file name without the dotted file type (e.g. "help.txt" has file name prefix = "help".)

      Parameters:
      fileType - dot followed by file suffix (e.g. ".mmp"). Selected files must have matching file suffix.
      lowestNamePrefix - Selected files must have names >= lowestNamePrefix, ignoring case.
      Returns:
      File array sorted by file name prefix of files within the folder with matching file type and file name prefix >= lowest file name.
      Throws:
      GMFFException - is security exception.

    • getFolderFile

      public File getFolderFile()
      Returns the File object for the GMFFFolder.
      Returns:
      File object for the GMFFFolder.

    • getAbsolutePath

      public String getAbsolutePath()
      Returns the absolute pathname of the GMFFFolder.
      Returns:
      Absolute pathname of the GMFFFolder or null if the underlying File is null.
